title: PINK TRIANGLE FAGGOT 2
media: silkscreen, blood, maypole ribbons, glass beads, sequins, paillettes, buttons, found tatting, amber, amethyst, shell, pre-stretched canvas
description: Faggot silkscreen designed by Kamran Akhavan. I was walking down the street, thinking about fascists when I fell and skinned my knee. The only thing I had to wipe up the blood were some silkscreened faggot patches in my bag. The shadows of silkscreened faggots can be seen on the interlaced pink fabric. Many of the beads, sequins and paillettes were found on artist’s floor, usually after parties. Ribbons with stains from actual maypoles.

title: FAGGOTS NOT TOUCHED BY THE FLAME – BLUE
media: silkscreen, men’s handkerchief, polyester fabric, glass beads, sequins, fresh water pearls, pre-stretched canvas
description: Faggot silkscreen designed by Kamran Akhavan. Silkscreened handkerchief over silkscreened patch, aged sequins. Created during the 2017 forest fire in Santa Rosa. Fire or water?

title: FAGGOT NOT TOUCHED BY THE FLAME 2 – RED, YELLOW

title: FAG GOT
media: silkscreen on silk, found camouflage fabric, glass beads, Swarovski crystal beads, paillettes, beaded trim, pre-stretched canvas
description: Faggot silkscreen designed by Kamran Akhavan. Gold paillettes from fabric used in Turbulence (a Dance about the Economy) instigated by Keith     Hennessy and produced by Circo Zero.

title: KISS FAGGOTS
media: silkscreen, upcycled wedding dress satin fabric, glass beads, paillettes, beaded trim, pre-stretched canvas, lipstick prints
description: Faggot silkscreen designed by Kamran Akhavan. Years ago, there used to be this event in San Francisco called Skirt Sunday. A bunch of us radical Faeries would meet at someone’s house in the Haight, put on skirts and walk to the Castro to parade around, back when wearing a skirt in the Castro was transgressive. On one Skirt Sunday we were sashaying through Buena Vista Park and came across a graffito that read: KILL FAGS. Someone had a gold marker in the pocket of their skirt. They whipped out that marker and changed the ‘L’s to ‘S’s. So now it read: KISS FAGS. Then we put on lipstick and kissed the wall around the letters. That experience inspired me to do this piece.

title: CAMO FAGGOT
media: silkscreen, found camouflage fabric, ribbon, glass beads, sequins, sequin trim, braid, pre-stretched canvas
description: Faggot silkscreen designed by Kamran Akhavan. The inspiration for the camouflage came from radical faerie skirts, envisioned by Harry Hay. As OSKRR the creator of faerie skirts would say, 'They are the Mother’s colors.'
